content.question:
<math alttext="A l solid reacts to produce, A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous, plus 3 electrons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons, reacts to produce S n solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

Based on the half-reactions represented above, which of the following is the balanced ionic equation for the oxidation-reduction reaction between <math alttext="A l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="A l solid, plus S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, reacts to produce, A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous, plus S n solid, plus one electron" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3 A l solid, plus 2 S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, reacts to produce, 3 A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous, plus 2 S n solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 A l solid, plus 3 S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, reacts to produce 2 A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus 3 S n solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A l solid, plus S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons, reacts to produce A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus S n solid, plus 3 electrons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 A l solid, plus 3 S n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, reacts to produce 2 A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus 3 S n solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Sn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Sn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
